intro: Pausandra, commonly known as false lily of the valley, is a genus of flowering plants in the familyApiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to eastern North America. The plants typically have compound leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. They are often found in moist, wooded areas and can grow up to several feet tall. Pausandra species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
